grab.英释: to get something for yourself, sometimes in an unfair way

flaw.英释: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

dust.英释: dry powder consisting of extremely small bits of dirt that is in buildings on furniture, floors etc if they are not kept clean

emit.英释: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

tide.英释: a current of water caused by the tide

sway.英释: to influence someone so that they change their opinion

harm.英释: to have a bad effect on something

soar.英释: to increase quickly to a high level

gift.英释: something that you give someone, for example to thank them or because you like them, especially on a special occasion

item.中释: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
item.英释: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

poll.英释: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

rank.英释: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc

fund.英释: to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc

hire.英释: to employ someone for a short time to do a particular job

task.英释: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly

fate.英释: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

surf.英释: to ride on waves while standing on a special board

code.英释: a system of words, letters, or symbols that you use instead of ordinary writing, so that the information can only be understood by someone else who knows the system

clue.英释: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

rare.英释: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

mood.英释: the way you feel at a particular time

curb.英释: an influence which helps to control or limit something

save.英释: to use less money, time, energy etc so that you do not waste any

site.英释: a place where something important or interesting happened

gear.英释: to be organized in a way that is suitable for a particular purpose or situation

pose.英释: the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

mask.英释: to hide your feelings or the truth about a situation

cite.英释: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

chef.英释: a skilled cook, especially the main cook in a hotel or restaurant

rate.英释: the number of times something happens, or the number of examples of something within a certain period

loan.英释: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

menu.英释: a list of all the kinds of food that are available for a meal, especially in a restaurant

flow.英释: when a liquid, gas, or electricity flows, it moves in a steady continuous stream

mill.英释: a factory that produces materials such as cotton, cloth, or steel

dump.英释: If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.

vary.英释: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

long.英释: to want something very much, especially when it seems unlikely to happen soon

ease.英释: Ease is the state of being very comfortable and able to live as you want, without any worries or problems

tent.英释: a shelter consisting of a sheet of cloth supported by poles and ropes, used especially for camping

fair.英释: an outdoor event, at which there are large machines to ride on, games to play, and sometimes farm animals being judged and sold

riot.英释: a situation in which a large crowd of people are behaving in a violent and uncontrolled way, especially when they are protesting about something

stir.英释: to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

grid.英释: the network of electricity supply wires that connects  power stations  and provides electricity to buildings in an area

view.英释: to think about something or someone in a particular way

fuss.英释: anxious behaviour or activity that is usually about unimportant things

peer.英释: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

chat.英释: to talk in a friendly informal way, especially about things that are not important

evil.英释: something that is very bad or harmful

debt.英释: a sum of money that a person or organization owes

chap.英释: a man, especially a man you know and like

vote.英释: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

melt.英释: if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid

wise.英释: wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment

ring.英释: a small square area surrounded by ropes, where people  box  or  wrestle

myth.英释: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

fine.英释: to make someone pay money as a punishment

rude.英释: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people

tank.英释: a large container for storing liquid or gas

sake.英释: in order to help, improve, or please someone or something

golf.英释: a game in which the players hit a small white ball into holes in the ground with a set of golf clubs, using as few hits as possible

wrap.英释: a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders

rope.英释: to tie things together using rope

lens.中释: 透镜， 镜片， 镜头
lens.英释: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

peak.英释: the time when something or someone is best, greatest, highest, most successful etc

weld.英释: to join metals by melting their edges and pressing them together when they are hot

pill.英释: a small solid piece of medicine that you swallow whole

bump.中释: 碰撞， 猛撞； 肿块； 隆起物
bump.英释: an area of skin that is raised because you have hit it on something

bulb.英释: the glass part of an electric light, that the light shines from

bulk.英释: the size of something or someone

pine.英释: a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter

pint.英释: a unit for measuring an amount of liquid, especially beer or milk. In Britain a pint is equal to 0.568 litres, and in the US it is equal to 0.473 litres.

fuel.英释: if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

pray.中释: 祈祷， 祈求； 请求， 恳求
pray.英释: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

lest.英释: in order to make sure that something will not happen

lane.中释: 小路； 跑道； 航道， 航线
lane.英释: a narrow road in the countryside

obey.英释: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do

lamb.中释: 羔羊， 小羊； 羔羊肉

tidy.英释: to make a place look tidy

pace.英释: the speed at which something happens or is done

pack.英释: a small container, usually made of paper, that something is sold in

volt.英释: a unit for measuring the force of an electric current

clay.中释: 黏土， 泥土； 肉体
clay.英释: a type of heavy sticky earth that can be used for making pots, bricks etc

quiz.英释: to ask someone a lot of questions

claw.英释: a sharp curved nail on an animal, bird, or some insects

clap.英释: the loud sound that you make when you hit your hands together many times to show that you enjoyed something

tray.英释: a flat piece of plastic, metal, or wood, with raised edges, used for carrying things such as plates, food etc

palm.中释: 手掌， 掌状物； 棕榈树
palm.英释: the inside surface of your hand, in which you hold things

trap.英释: to catch an animal or bird using a trap

lawn.中释: 草地， 草坪， 草场
lawn.英释: an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass

beam.中释: 面露喜色； 定向发出， 播送
beam.英释: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

zone.中释: 地区， 区域， 范围
zone.英释: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way

bean.英释: a seed or a  pod (=  case containing seeds  )  , that comes from a climbing plant and is cooked as food. There are very many types of beans.

soak.英释: if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean

tend.英释: if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

soda.中释: 碳酸钠， 纯碱； 汽水， 苏打水
soda.英释: water that contains bubbles and is often added to alcoholic drinks

chew.英释: to bite food several times before swallowing it

bind.中释: 捆绑， 包扎； 装订； 约束； 使结合， 使黏合
bind.英释: if you are bound by an agreement, promise etc, you must do what you have agreed to do or promised to do

trim.英释: to move the sails of a boat in order to go faster

cube.英释: a solid object with six equal square sides

mild.中释: 温柔的； 温暖的； 轻微的

dose.中释: 剂量， 用量， 一剂
dose.英释: the amount of a medicine or a drug that you should take

chip.中释: 屑片， 碎片； 炸土豆条； 集成电路片， 集成块； 缺口， 瑕疵
chip.英释: a small piece of  silicon  that has a set of complicated electrical connections on it and is used to store and  process  information in computers

chin.英释: the front part of your face below your mouth

mist.英释: a light cloud low over the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far

loaf.英释: bread that is shaped and baked in one piece and can be cut into slices

sole.英释: the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

jury.英释: a group of 12 ordinary people who listen to the details of a case in court and decide whether someone is guilty or not

holy.中释: 神圣的， 圣洁的， 虔诚的

tame.中释: 制服， 控制并利用； 驯化， 驯服
tame.英释: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble

envy.英释: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc

hook.英释: a curved piece of metal or plastic that you use for hanging things on

chop.英释: a small piece of meat on a bone, usually cut from a sheep or pig

skim.中释: 撇去， 掠过， 擦过； 浏览， 略读
skim.英释: to remove something from the surface of a liquid, especially floating fat, solids, or oil

maid.英释: a female servant, especially in a large house or hotel

horn.中释: 角； 号角； 警报器
horn.英释: the hard pointed thing that grows, usually in pairs, on the heads of animals such as cows and goats

sore.英释: a painful, often red, place on your body caused by a wound or infection

glow.英释: A glow is a pink colour on a person's face, usually because they are healthy or have been exercising

mess.中释: 弄糟， 弄脏， 搞乱
mess.英释: to make something look untidy or dirty

sour.中释: 变酸， 变馊； 变得乖戾
sour.英释: if milk sours, or if something sours it, it begins to have an unpleasant sharp taste

bake.英释: to cook something using dry heat, in an  oven

curl.中释: 鬈发； 卷曲， 卷曲物
curl.英释: a piece of hair that hangs in a curved shape

glue.英释: to join two things together using glue

bang.英释: to hit something hard, making a loud noise

brow.英释: the part of your face above your eyes and below your hair

scan.英释: a medical test in which a special machine produces a picture of something inside your body

wolf.英释: a wild animal that looks like a large dog and lives and hunts in groups

wool.中释: 羊毛； 毛线， 绒线
wool.英释: the soft thick hair that sheep and some goats have on their body

barn.英释: a large farm building for storing crops, or for keeping animals in

bark.中释: 吠声， 叫声； 树皮
bark.英释: the sharp loud sound made by a dog

loop.英释: a shape like a curve or a circle made by a line curving back towards itself, or a piece of wire, string etc that has this shape

bare.英释: to remove something that was covering or hiding something

ruin.英释: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed

mass.中释: 众多，大量；团，块，堆；群众；质量

lord.中释: 领主， 君主， 贵族
lord.英释: a man who has a rank in the  aristocracy  , especially in Britain, or his title

poem.英释: a piece of writing that expresses emotions, experiences, and ideas, especially in short lines using words that  rhyme (= end with the same sound )

gulf.英释: a large area of sea partly enclosed by land

stem.中释: 堵住， 止住， 停住
stem.英释: to stop the flow of a liquid

worm.英释: a long thin creature with no bones and no legs that lives in soil

mate.中释: 伙伴，同事；配偶，配对物；大副
mate.英释: someone you work with, do an activity with, or share something with

span.中释: 持续， 贯穿； 包括； 横跨， 跨越
span.英释: to include all of a period of time

pole.中释: 杆； 极， 磁极， 电极
pole.英释: one of two points at the ends of a  magnet  where its power is the strongest

frog.英释: a small green animal that lives near water and has long legs for jumping

fame.英释: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

pond.英释: a small area of fresh water that is smaller than a lake, that is either natural or artificially made

rust.英释: the reddish-brown substance that forms on iron or steel when it gets wet

fare.英释: the price you pay to travel somewhere by bus, train, plane etc

slam.英释: the noise or action of a door, window etc slamming

spin.英释: an act of turning around quickly

slap.英释: a quick hit with the flat part of your hand

spit.英释: the watery liquid that is produced in your mouth

acid.英释: a chemical substance that has a  pH  of less than 7. Strong acids can burn holes in material or damage your skin

jail.中释: 监禁， 拘留； 塞满； 卡住； 干扰

ache.英释: a continuous pain that is not sharp or very strong

undo.中释: 解开， 打开； 取消， 撤销
undo.英释: to open something that is tied, fastened or wrapped

pour.英释: to make a liquid or other substance flow out of or into a container by holding it at an angle

slim.英释: to make yourself thinner by eating less, taking a lot of exercise etc

spot.中释: 认出， 发现； 玷污
spot.英释: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

tone.中释: 腔调， 语气； 音调； 风格， 气度； 色调， 明暗
tone.英释: the way your voice sounds, which shows how you are feeling or what you mean

crew.中释: 全体船员； 一队工作人员
crew.英释: all the people who work on a ship or plane

slip.英释: A slip is a small or unimportant mistake

shed.英释: a small building, often made of wood, used especially for storing things

spur.中释: 刺激， 鞭策， 激励
spur.英释: to encourage someone or make them want to do something

rear.中释: 抚养， 饲养； 种植
rear.英释: to look after a person or animal until they are fully grown

dumb.中释: 哑的； 无言的； 说不出话的
dumb.英释: unable to speak, because you are angry, surprised, shocked etc

acre.英释: a unit for measuring area, equal to 4,840 square yards or 4,047 square metres

dull.中释: 乏味的， 单调的； 晦暗的， 阴沉的； 低沉的； 笨的； 钝的
dull.英释: not bright and with lots of clouds

echo.英释: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall

ripe.英释: ripe fruit or crops are fully grown and ready to eat

vice.中释: 罪恶； 恶习， 缺点； 虎钳
vice.英释: criminal activities that involve sex or drugs

gram.英释: the basic unit for measuring weight in the  metric system

nest.英释: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in

tour.英释: a journey for pleasure, during which you visit several different towns, areas etc

calm.英释: to become quiet and relaxed after you have been angry, excited, nervous, or upset, or to make someone become quiet and relaxed

suck.中释: 吸， 吮， 啜； 吸收
suck.英释: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in

jazz.中释: 爵士音乐， 爵士舞曲
jazz.英释: a type of music that has a strong beat and parts for performers to play alone

dusk.中释: 薄暮， 黄昏； 幽暗
dusk.英释: the time before it gets dark when the sky is becoming less bright

mold.中释: 用模子制作， 塑造； 使形成， 影响…的形成

bold.中释: 勇敢的； 鲁莽的； 粗体的， 黑体的； 醒目的
bold.英释: so confident or determined that you sometimes offend people

bolt.英释: to lock a door or window by sliding a bolt across

boom.中释: 激增，繁荣，迅速发展；隆隆声，嗡嗡声
boom.英释: a quick increase of business activity

ally.中释: 同盟国， 同盟者； 支持者
ally.英释: a country that agrees to help or support another country in a war

boot.中释: 靴子， 长筒靴； 行李箱； 解雇
boot.英释: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg

rack.中释: 使痛苦， 折磨； 尽力使用
rack.英释: If someone is racked by something such as illness or anxiety, it causes them great suffering or pain

bond.中释: 联结，联系；公债；契约，合同
bond.英释: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with  interest

risk.中释: 冒…的危险， 使遭受危险
risk.英释: to put something in a situation in which it could be lost, destroyed, or harmed

rent.英释: the money that someone pays regularly to use a room, house etc that belongs to someone else

cart.英释: a vehicle with no roof that is pulled by a horse and used for carrying heavy things

cast.中释: 演员表， 全体演员； 石膏绷带； 铸型， 铸件； 投， 抛
cast.英释: all the people who perform in a play, film etc

cash.英释: If you cash a cheque, you exchange it at a bank for the amount of money that it is worth

gene.英释: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

rely.中释: 依靠， 依赖； 信赖， 指望
rely.英释: If you rely on someone or something, you need them and depend on them in order to live or work properly

grip.英释: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

bore.英释: something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you

rage.中释: 狂怒，盛怒；风靡一时的事物，时尚
rage.英释: a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger

navy.英释: the part of a country’s military forces that fights at sea

whip.英释: a long thin piece of rope or leather with a handle, that you hit animals with to make them move or that you hit someone with to punish them

hunt.中释: 打猎； 搜寻； 驱逐
hunt.英释: to look for someone or something very carefully

rail.中释: 栏杆，横杆；铁轨，轨道；铁路

germ.中释: 微生物， 细菌； 幼芽
germ.英释: a very small living thing that can make you ill

keen.中释: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的， 敏捷的
keen.英释: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

omit.英释: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

raid.中释: 袭击； 突入查抄， 突入搜捕； 劫掠
raid.英释: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control

gang.英释: a group of criminals who work together

fold.英释: a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another

folk.中释: 人们； 家属， 亲属； 大伙儿， 各位

deaf.英释: physically unable to hear anything or unable to hear well

oval.英释: a shape like a circle, but wider in one direction than the other

deck.中释: 甲板， 舱面； 层面
deck.英释: one of the levels on a bus, plane etc

plot.中释: 故事情节；计划，密谋；小块土地
plot.英释: a secret plan by a group of people to do something harmful or illegal

lump.英释: a small piece of something solid, without a particular shape

oven.英释: a piece of equipment that food is cooked inside, shaped like a metal box with a door on the front

drag.中释: 累赘； 一吸， 一抽
drag.英释: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it

vain.英释: someone who is vain is too proud of their good looks, abilities, or position – used to show disapproval

lung.英释: one of the two organs in your body that you breathe with

auto.中释: 汽车；表示"自己"、"本身", 表示"自己的", 表示"自动的"

sigh.英释: an act or sound of sighing

dirt.中释: 灰尘， 土； 污物， 污垢
dirt.英释: any substance that makes things dirty, such as mud or dust

gaze.英释: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so

plug.英释: to fill or block a small hole

seal.英释: to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it

heal.中释: 使愈合，治愈，使康复；调停，消除
heal.英释: if a wound or a broken bone heals or is healed, the flesh, skin, or bone grows back together and becomes healthy again

dive.中释: 跳水； 潜水；  俯冲
dive.英释: to jump into deep water with your head and arms going in first

heap.英释: a large untidy pile of things

drip.英释: one of the drops of liquid that fall from something

deny.中释: 否定， 否认； 拒绝…的要求
deny.英释: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

heel.中释: 脚后跟， 踵； 后跟
heel.英释: the curved back part of your foot

pump.英释: to make liquid or gas move in a particular direction, using a pump

amid.中释: 在…中间， 在…之中， 被…围绕

vast.中释: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的

lick.英释: when you move your tongue across the surface of something

coil.英释: to wind or twist into a series of rings, or to make something do this

tube.中释: 管， 电子管， 显像管
tube.英释: a round pipe made of metal, glass, rubber etc, especially for liquids or gases to go through

hint.中释: 暗示，示意；细微的迹象；建议
hint.英释: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly

knot.英释: to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc

damp.中释: 使潮湿； 使沮丧； 抑制

damn.中释: 该死的〔表示对某人或某事物生气〕
damn.英释: used when you are angry or annoyed with someone or something

sack.中释: 解雇； 洗劫， 劫掠
sack.英释: to dismiss someone from their job

hell.英释: the place where the souls of bad people are believed to be punished after death, especially in the Christian and Muslim religions

roar.中释: 呐喊声， 咆哮声， 吼叫声； 轰鸣
roar.英释: a deep, loud noise made by an animal such as a lion, or by someone’s voice

comb.中释: 梳理； 在…搜寻； 彻底搜查
comb.英释: to make hair look tidy using a comb

tyre.英释: a thick rubber ring that fits around the wheel of a car, bicycle etc

cope.英释: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation

leak.英释: a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

lean.英释: thin in a healthy and attractive way

flat.英释: a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building

drum.英释: a musical instrument made of skin stretched over a circular frame, played by hitting it with your hand or a stick

ugly.英释: extremely unattractive and unpleasant to look at

cord.中释: 细绳， 粗线， 索； 灯芯绒裤
cord.英释: a piece of thick string or thin rope

core.中释: 果实的心； 核心， 要点
core.英释: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple

dash.英释: an occasion when someone runs somewhere very quickly in order to get away from something or someone, or in order to reach them

link.中释: 环节， 联系， 纽带
link.英释: a way in which two things or ideas are related to each other

flee.中释: 逃走， 逃掉， 逃离； 避开， 逃避
flee.英释: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

tune.中释: 调整， 调节； 为调音
tune.英释: to make a musical instrument play at the right  pitch

weep.中释: 哭泣， 流泪； 渗出
weep.英释: to cry, especially because you feel very sad

limp.英释: the way someone walks when they are limping

weed.英释: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly

herd.英释: to make animals move together in a group

limb.中释: 肢， 臂， 腿； 树枝

snap.英释: a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

down.英释: to or towards a lower place or position

lake.英释: a large area of water surrounded by land

draw.英释: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

lift.英释: a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building

fact.英释: a piece of information that is known to be true

cool.英释: low in temperature, but not cold, often in a way that feels pleasant

more.英释: having a particular quality to a greater degree

mend.英释: to repair a tear or hole in a piece of clothing

hare.英释: an animal like a rabbit but larger, which can run very quickly

best.英释: better than anything else or anyone else in quality, skill, how effective it is etc

meet.英释: to see someone by chance and talk to them

lose.英释: to stop having a particular attitude, quality, ability etc, or to gradually have less of it

bell.英释: a piece of electrical equipment that makes a ringing sound, used as a signal or to get someone’s attention

mean.英释: to have or represent a particular meaning

call.英释: to use a word or name to describe someone or something in a particular way

pipe.英释: a tube through which a liquid or gas flows

exam.英释: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one

roll.英释: if something rolls, especially something round, or if you roll it, it moves along a surface by turning over and over

cold.英释: a low temperature or cold weather

moan.英释: to make a long low sound expressing pain, unhappiness, or sexual pleasure

pale.英释: having a skin colour that is very white, or whiter than it usually is

hawk.英释: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals

unit.英释: a thing, person, or group that is regarded as one single whole part of something larger

home.英释: relating to or belonging to your home or family

army.英释: the part of a country’s military force that is trained to fight on land in a war

fork.英释: a tool you use for picking up and eating food, with a handle and three or four points

duck.中释: 鸭；中文释义: 雌鸭；鸭肉
duck.英释: a very common water bird with short legs and a wide beak, used for its meat, eggs, and soft feathers

atom.英释: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

flag.英释: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization

hair.英释: the mass of things like fine threads that grows on your head

leaf.英释: one of the flat green parts of a plant that are joined to its stem or branches

dish.英释: a flat container with low sides, for serving food from or cooking food in

come.英释: to move towards you or arrive at the place where you are

lion.英释: a large animal of the cat family that lives in Africa and parts of southern Asia. Lions have gold-coloured fur and the male has a mane (long hair around its neck ).

type.英释: to write something using a computer or a typewriter

pear.英释: a sweet juicy fruit that has a round base and is thinner near the top, or the tree that produces this fruit

mind.英释: your thoughts or your ability to think, feel, and imagine things

blow.英释: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves

bite.英释: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

list.英释: to write a list, or mention things one after the other

feed.英释: to give food to a person or animal

play.英释: when children play, they do things that they enjoy, often with other people or with toys

past.英释: the time that existed before the present

burn.英释: an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

rain.英释: if it rains, drops of water fall from clouds in the sky

part.英释: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time

hear.英释: to know that a sound is being made, using your ears

sort.英释: to put things in a particular order or arrange them in groups according to size, type etc

lame.英释: unable to walk properly because your leg or foot is injured or weak

next.英释: coming straight after sb/sth in time, order or space

knee.英释: the joint that bends in the middle of your leg

mail.英释: to send a letter or package to someone

busy.英释: if you are busy, you are working hard and have a lot of things to do

inch.英释: a unit for measuring length, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.

coin.英释: to make pieces of money from metal

away.英释: used to say that someone leaves a place or person, or stays some distance from a place or person

gasp.英释: to breathe quickly in a way that can be heard because you are having difficulty breathing

mile.英释: a unit for measuring distance, equal to 1,760  yard s  or about 1,609 metres

club.中释: 〔职业体育的〕俱乐部；俱乐部；夜总会
club.英释: a professional organization including the players, managers, and owners of a sports team

fall.英释: to move or drop down from a higher position to a lower position

meat.英释: the flesh of animals and birds eaten as food

kill.英释: to make a person or animal die

goat.英释: an animal that has horns on top of its head and long hair under its chin, and can climb steep hills and rocks. Goats live wild in the mountains or are kept as farm animals.

pull.英释: an act of using force to move something towards you or in the same direction that you are moving

boss.英释: to tell people to do things, give them orders etc, especially when you have no authority to do it

pity.英释: to feel sorry for someone because they are in a very bad situation

care.英释: when you are careful to avoid damage, mistakes etc

easy.英释: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort

pure.英释: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added

file.英释: to keep papers, documents etc in a particular place so that you can find them easily

good.英释: of a high standard or quality

load.英释: a large quantity of something that is carried by a vehicle, person etc

hand.英释: the part of your body at the end of your arm, including your fingers and thumb, that you use to hold things

liar.英释: someone who deliberately says things which are not true

goal.英释: something that you hope to achieve in the future

bear.英释: a large strong animal with thick fur, that eats flesh, fruit, and insects

page.英释: one side of a piece of paper in a book, newspaper, document etc, or the sheet of paper itself

hero.英释: a man who is admired for doing something extremely brave

kick.英释: a movement with the foot or the leg, usually to hit sth with the foot

gown.英释: a long loose piece of clothing worn for special ceremonies by judges, teachers, lawyers, and members of universities

shot.英释: the act of firing a gun; the sound this makes

ball.英释: a round object that is thrown, kicked, or hit in a game or sport

dock.英释: a place in a port where ships are loaded, unloaded, or repaired

join.英释: to begin to take part in an activity that other people are involved in

poor.英释: having very little money and not many possessions

real.英释: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial

luck.英释: good things that happen to you by chance

half.英释: exactly or about 50% (1/2) of an amount, time, distance, number etc

lamp.英释: an object that produces light by using electricity, oil, or gas

line.英释: a long thin mark on a piece of paper, the ground, or another surface

bury.英释: to put someone who has died in a  grave

firm.英释: a business or company, especially a small one

grey.英释: the colour of dark clouds, neither black nor white

gray.英释: the colour of smoke or ashes

also.英释: in addition to something else that you have mentioned

seek.英释: to look for someone or something

lack.英释: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it

hope.英释: a feeling of wanting something to happen or be true and believing that it is possible or likely

east.英释: to or in the countries in Asia, especially China and Japan

wage.英释: to be involved in a war against someone, or a fight against something

name.英释: to say what the name of someone or something is, especially officially

note.英释: something that you write down to remind you of something

both.英释: used to talk about two people, things etc together, and emphasize that each is included

axis.英释: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

keep.英释: to stay in a particular state, condition, or position, or to make someone or something do this

cake.英释: a soft sweet food made by baking a mixture of flour, butter, sugar, and eggs

edge.英释: the part of an object that is furthest from its centre

slit.英释: to make a straight narrow cut in cloth, paper, skin etc

base.英释: the lowest part or surface of something

okay.英释: You can say "Okay" to show that you agree to something.

lead.英释: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

cook.英释: to prepare food for eating by using heat

deal.英释: an agreement or arrangement, especially in business or politics, that helps both sides involved

sign.英释: to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

hide.英释: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

deed.英释: something someone does, especially something that is very good or very bad

milk.英释: to take milk from a cow or goat

meal.英释: an occasion when you eat food, for example breakfast or dinner, or the food that you eat on that occasion

high.英释: at or to a level high above the ground, the floor etc

born.英释: having a natural ability or skill for a particular activity or job

nose.英释: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing

grow.英释: to become bigger, taller etc over a period of time in the process of becoming an adult

park.英释: a large open area with grass and trees, especially in a town, where people can walk, play games etc

into.英释: to the inside or inner part of a container, place, area etc

lazy.英释: not liking work and physical activity, or not making any effort to do anything

hurt.英释: to injure yourself or someone else

date.英释: to write or print the date on something

copy.英释: to deliberately make or produce something that is exactly like another thing

silk.英释: a thin smooth soft cloth made from very thin thread which is produced by a silkworm

idea.英释: a plan or suggestion for a possible course of action, especially one that you think of suddenly

blue.英释: the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day

neck.英释: the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird

lady.英释: used as the title of the wife or daughter of a British noblemanor the wife of a knight

rush.英释: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon

brim.英释: the top edge of a container

bend.英释: to push or press something so that it is no longer flat or straight

lock.英释: to fasten something, usually with a key, so that other people cannot open it, or to be fastened like this

moon.英释: the round object that you can see shining in the sky at night, and that moves around the Earth every 28 days

tale.英释: a story about exciting imaginary events

bomb.英释: to attack a place by leaving a bomb there, or by dropping bombs on it from a plane

hill.英释: an area of land that is higher than the land around it, like a mountain but smaller

camp.英释: a place where people stay in tents, shelters etc for a short time, usually in the mountains, a forest etc

need.英释: to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them

food.中释: 食物，食品；养料，精神食粮
food.英释: things that people and animals eat, such as vege-tables or meat

fist.英释: the hand when it is tightly closed, so that the fingers are curled in towards the  palm . People close their hand in a fist when they are angry or are going to hit someone.

mine.英释: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

Asia.英释: the largest continent with 60% of the earth's population; it is joined to Europe on the west to form Eurasia; it is the site of some of the world's earliest civilizations

body.英释: the physical structure of a person or animal

wave.英释: if you wave something, or if it waves, it moves from side to side

dawn.英释: if day or morning dawns, it begins

pass.英释: to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them

deer.英释: a large wild animal that can run very fast, eats grass, and has horns

bowl.英释: a wide round container that is open at the top, used to hold liquids, food, flowers etc

hard.英释: firm, stiff, and difficult to press down, break, or cut

wear.英释: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this

heat.英释: to make something become warm or hot

most.英释: having the greatest amount of a particular quality

hold.英释: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

like.英释: to enjoy something or think that it is nice or good

cure.英释: the act of making someone well again after an illness

bird.英释: a creature with wings and feathers that can usually fly. Many birds sing and build nests, and female birds lay eggs

door.英释: a piece of wood, glass, etc. that is opened and closed so that people can get in and out of a room, building, car, etc.; a similar thing in a cupboard/closet

beat.英释: to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard

desk.英释: a piece of furniture like a table, usually with drawers in it, that you sit at to write and work

cost.英释: the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy, do, or produce something

earn.英释: to receive a particular amount of money for the work that you do

pile.英释: to arrange things in a pile

cell.英释: the smallest part of a living thing that can exist independently

pair.英释: to put people or things into groups of two, or to form groups of two

lime.英释: a white substance obtained by burning limestone, used for making cement, marking sports fields etc

dial.英释: to press the buttons or turn the dial on a telephone in order to make a telephone call

fill.英释: if a container or place fills, or if you fill it, enough of something goes into it to make it full

ours.英释: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with us

cafe.英释: a place where you can buy drinks and simple meals. Alcohol is not usually served in British or American cafes.

post.英释: to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board

drop.英释: to fall suddenly onto the ground or into something

bill.英释: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

dear.英释: used to show that you are surprised, upset, or annoyed because something bad has happened

mode.英释: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

coal.英释: a hard black mineral which is dug out of the ground and burnt to produce heat

look.英释: an act of looking at something

free.英释: not held, tied up, or kept somewhere as a prisoner

fear.英释: to feel afraid or worried that something bad may happen

loss.英释: the fact of no longer having something, or of having less of it than you used to have, or the process by which this happens

June.英释: the sixth month of the year, between May and July

beer.英释: an alcoholic drink made from  malt  and  hop s

hers.英释: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned

from.英释: used to show what the origin of sb/sth is

film.英释: a story that is told using sound and moving pictures, shown at a cinema or on television

bank.英释: an organization that provides various financial services, for example keeping or lending money

help.英释: things you do to make it easier or possible for someone to do something

even.英释: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

left.英释: on the same side of something as your left side

farm.英释: an area of land used for growing crops or keeping animals

fond.英释: feeling affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time

knob.英释: a round handle or thing that you turn to open a door, turn on a television etc

duty.英释: something that you have to do because it is morally or legally right

coat.英释: a piece of clothing with long sleeves that is worn over your clothes to protect them or to keep you warm

gain.英释: an increase in the amount or level of something

heir.英释: the person who has the legal right to receive the property or title of another person when they die

kite.英释: a light frame covered in coloured paper or plastic that you let fly in the air on the end of one or two long strings

move.英释: when someone moves for a short time in a particular direction

crow.英释: if a cock crows, it makes a loud high sound

thus.英释: as a result of something that you have just mentioned

aunt.英释: the sister of your father or mother, or the wife of your father’s or mother’s brother

book.英释: to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future

plan.英释: to think carefully about something you want to do, and decide how and when you will do it

baby.英释: a very young child who has not yet learned to speak or walk

back.英释: in, into, or to the place or position where someone or something was before

jump.英释: to push yourself up into the air, or over or away from something etc, using your legs

only.英释: used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others

hour.英释: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour, and 24 hours in one day.

crop.中释: 农作物，庄稼；一熟：一季的收成
crop.英释: a plant such as wheat, rice, or fruit that is grown by farmers and used as food

feel.英释: to experience a particular physical feeling or emotion

game.英释: an activity or sport in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules

yard.英释: the area around a house, usually covered with grass

soil.英释: to make something dirty, especially with waste from your body

lace.英释: a string that is pulled through special holes in shoes or clothing to pull the edges together and fasten them

area.英释: a particular part of a country, town etc

cave.英释: a large natural hole in the side of a cliff or hill, or under the ground

news.英释: reports of recent events in the newspapers or on the radio or television

here.英释: used after a verb or preposition to mean ‘in, at or to this position or place ’

king.英释: a man who rules a country because he is from a royal family

noun.英释: a word or group of words that represent a person (such as ‘Michael’, ‘teacher’ or ‘police officer’), a place (such as ‘France’ or ‘school’), a thing or activity (such as ‘coffee’ or ‘football’), or a quality or idea (such as ‘danger’ or ‘happiness’). Nouns can be used as the subject or object of a verb (as in ‘The teacher arrived’ or ‘We like the teacher’) or as the object of a preposition (as in ‘good at football’).

main.英释: larger or more important than all other things, ideas etc of the same kind

have.英释: used to say that someone owns something or that it is available for them to use

twin.英释: one of two children born at the same time to the same mother

wing.英释: oone of the parts of the body of a bird, insect or bat that it uses for flying

give.英释: used with a noun to describe a particular action, giving the same meaning as the related verb

suit.英释: to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

pain.英释: the feeling you have when part of your body hurts

July.英释: the seventh month of the year, between June and August

path.英释: a track that has been made deliberately or made by many people walking over the same ground

belt.英释: a band of leather, cloth etc that you wear around your waist to hold up your clothes or for decoration

open.英释: to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way

cage.英释: a structure made of wires or bars in which birds or animals can be kept

knit.英释: to make clothing out of wool, using two knitting needles

boil.英释: when a liquid boils or when you boil it, it is heated to the point where it forms bubbles and turns to steam or vapour

love.英释: a strong feeling of caring about someone, especially a member of your family or a close friend

nail.英释: to fasten something to something else with nails

fail.英释: to not succeed in achieving something

onto.英释: used to say that someone or something moves to a position on a surface, area, or object

face.英释: the front part of your head, where your eyes, nose, and mouth are

card.英释: a small piece of plastic or paper containing information about a person or showing, for example, that they belong to a particular organization, club etc

bush.英释: a plant with many thin branches growing up from the ground

hall.英释: the area just inside the door of a house or other building, that leads to other rooms

huge.英释: extremely large in size, amount, or degree

port.英释: a place where ships can be loaded and unloaded

lend.英释: to let someone borrow money or something that belongs to you for a short time

sail.英释: to travel on or across an area of water in a boat or ship

read.英释: to look at written words and understand what they mean

kind.英释: one of the different types of a person or thing that belong to the same group

able.英释: to have the skill, strength, knowledge etc needed to do something

full.英释: containing as much or as many things or people as possible, so there is no space left

foot.英释: the part of your body that you stand on and walk on

wire.英释: thin metal in the form of a thread, or a piece of this

form.英释: to start to exist, or make something start to exist, especially as the result of a natural process

host.英释: someone at a party, meal etc who has invited the guests and who provides the food, drink etc

miss.英释: used in front of the family name of a woman who is not married to address her politely, to write to her, or to talk about her

fool.英释: to trick someone into believing something that is not true

tire.英释: to start to feel tired, or make someone feel tired

dare.英释: to be brave enough to do something that is risky or that you are afraid to do – used especially in questions or negative sentences

pool.英释: a hole or container that has been specially made and filled with water so that people can swim or play in it

gate.英释: the part of a fence or outside wall that you can open and close so that you can enter or leave a place

seed.英释: one of the small hard objects in a fruit such as an apple or orange, from which new fruit trees grow

bath.英释: an act of washing your whole body by sitting or lying in water

talk.英释: to say things; to speak in order to give information or to express feelings, ideas, etc.

ever.英释: used in negative sentences and questions, or sentences with if to mean ‘at any time’

each.英释: used to refer to every one of two or more people or things, when you are thinking about them separately

must.英释: to have to do something because it is necessary or important, or because of a law or order

corn.英释: plants such as wheat,  barley  , and  oats  or their seeds

deep.英释: going far down from the top or from the surface

case.英释: a particular situation or a situation of a particular type

iron.英释: to make clothes, etc. smooth by using an iron

bull.英释: an adult male animal of the cattle family

joke.英释: to say things that are intended to be funny and that you do not really mean

less.英释: not so much or to a smaller degree

find.英释: to get back sth/sb that was lost after searching for it/them

cent.英释: 1/100th of the standard unit of money in some countries. For example, there are 100 cents in one dollar or in one  euro  : symbol ¢.

exit.英释: to finish using a computer program

over.英释: above or higher than something, without touching it

disk.英释: (<英> disc)a small flat piece of plastic or metal which is used for storing computer or electronic information

dark.英释: with no or very little light, especially because it is night

hang.英释: to attach sth, or to be attached, at the top so that the lower part is free or loose

life.英释: the period of time when someone is alive

head.英释: to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc

push.英释: to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc

make.英释: to produce something, for example by putting the different parts of it together

wind.英释: to turn or twist something several times around something else

race.英释: a situation in which one group of people tries to obtain or achieve something before another group does

drug.英释: a medicine, or a substance for making medicines

hole.英释: an empty space in something solid

bone.英释: one of the hard parts that together form the frame of a human, animal, or fish body

want.英释: something that you need or want

boat.英释: a vehicle that travels across water
